author: Staff Reporter
text:
‘If AIADMK aligns with BJP, Manithaneya Jananayaga Katchi will not support it’

Thamimun Ansari, whose faction broke away from the Manithaneya Makkal Katchi and formed the Manithaneya Jananayaga Katchi, said on Friday that his newly formed party will align with the ruling AIADMK in the forthcoming Assembly elections in Tamil Nadu.

“We will present our side to the Chief Minister. We will soon know about how many seats we are going to get,” he said.

Mr. Ansari said that the decision to go with the AIADMK was taken by the party members on the basis that there have been no attacks on minorities in the State in the last five years. “The last five years have been peaceful with no violence against the minority communities. Like wise, our party will also stand for pluralism and will include members from all communities,” he said.

Asked how they would reconcile with the AIADMK’s unfulfilled promise made in 2011 that they would increase the reservation for minorities, Mr. Ansari said that they would continue to push the ruling AIADMK on that issue.

With political parties trying to seek new alliances, Mr. Ansari said that his party would not support the AIADMK if the party decides to join hands with the BJP. “If that happens, we will not support the AIADMK,” he said.

Mr. Ansari also said that he would not like to compete directly with the candidates fielded by the MMK in each constituency. “We will try to avoid that as much as possible,” he said.

The party will soon conduct a public meeting in which several leaders associated with the AIADMK alliance are expected to speak.

‘If AIADMK aligns with BJP, Manithaneya Jananayaga Katchi will not support it’
title: Thamimun Ansari faction to join AIADMK alliance
